item.title: Converting Windows Server Core to Desktop for Debugging
item.description: Sometimes it’s necessary when debugging a machines issues to pop desktop support back on so you can RDP to the machine and quickly use tools that work properly rather than the half-arsed versions available via powershell where basic things like log viewing (get-events) requires you to faff and filter the log request down just so you can pipe it into another chunk of powershell to get the full log row as god forbid they learn how line wrap works or let you scroll like any linux shell / journalctl would.

item.title: Converting Windows Server Core to Desktop for Debugging
item.description: Quick and simple Remote to the machine / open powershell as admin Check current user Get-LocalUser Create new password you’ll use, as a secure-string $Password = Read-Host "Enter the new password" -AsSecureString Set the password of the user. (in this case admin) 1$UserAccount = Get-LocalUser -Name "administrator" 2$UserAccount | Set-LocalUser -Password $Password Done
